definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate

sentences.english: JDX Tea membership card has been changed to quality scores in exchange for Voucher to the program.
sentences.chinese: 九鼎香优质会员卡已更改为以分数换取礼券程式。

sentences.english: Our Company reserves this right for the final decision for this offer.
sentences.chinese: 本公司食府保留行使此礼券之最终决定权。

sentences.english: I received a gift certificate to stay at a charming bed-and –breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 我收到了一张礼券，凭此可以住在提供早餐的旅馆。

sentences.english: Women invade Shopping Center in nothing but bras, panties and high heels.
sentences.chinese: 英国以超市出台促销策略，女士只穿内衣购物赠礼券。

sentences.english: You can buy gift certificates too.
Give them a gift certificate for their favorite store.
sentences.chinese: 给他们一个他们最喜欢的商店的礼券。

definition: bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate
to exchange for (sth of equal value or utility)/to use in lieu/to redeem (a coupon etc)/to use to offset (an amount owed etc)
(Tw) to put money into (a stored-value card or pre-paid phone account)/to top up
to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle
store credit (credit to be spent at a specified retailer)
buy one, get one free/two for the price of one
fukubukuro or "lucky bag", Japanese New Year custom where merchants offer grab bags containing random products at a steep discount
